page.title: 05ROADS IN THE SEISDON AREA
page.content: The main road from Bridgnorth to Wolverhampton (A454) runs from west to east across the north of this block. It is very busy, carrying traffic of all types, especially the cars of commuters working in the West Midlands. It is also busy in the evenings and at weekends as Bridgnorth is a popular objective for outings and one of the few crossings of the River Severn. In spite of improvements the road is not wide and accidents happen frequently. The B4176, part of a very old route from Ironbridge in Shropshire to Dudley in the West Midlands, which crosses the south-west corner of the area, is also quite busy. The few remaining roads in the district are all country lanes and rather narrow.
